name: Joe Lusignan
statement_html:
Elected Experience
None

Other Professional Experience

Young Marines Deputy Director 2014-2020; Benton County Sheriff’s Department (Retired) 1992-2014; United States Marine Corps 1983-1990.

Education

Bachelor of Science in Liberal Arts from Excelsior College, New York

Community Service

Pasco-Kennewick Rotary; 20 years as an adult volunteer for the Young Marines; River View High School Booster Club; Riverview High School Classroom Volunteer Instructor; National Young Marines Board of Directors; Washington Council of Police & Sheriffs Executive Board of Directors; 2nd Harvest Board of Directors; Volunteer Youth Soccer Coach; American Legion; Veteran of Foreign Wars; Fraternal Order of Police.

Statement

My entire life has been dedicated to service and volunteerism with a focus on programs that strengthen the lives of our youth, serve, and honor our veterans, and enhance public safety efforts. I will serve Benton County full-time and provide the collaborative leadership that is needed to support our fast-growing community.
As your Benton County Commissioner, I will continue my focus on public safety, youth, and our veterans. Specific priority areas will be: better stewardship and accountability of your Public Safety Sales Tax dollars – revenue critical to continuing the local fight against crime and criminal gang activity; improved transparency and accountability for Commission meetings and decision processes; strengthening partnerships with community stakeholders and other local government leadership; and supporting efforts that will improve our emergency mental health and drug addiction programs. 
Benton County deserves a full-time leader. Not only am I 100% committed to the position, I will lead with integrity, transparency, and accountability. I will be available to the community and will work hard for you and with you.
Thank you for your support!

Contact

Website: www.go4joe.us; email: jlusignan@usa.com; Facebook: Joe Lusignan for Benton Co Commissioner
